header_summary: Email 1:ZmnSCPxj discusses the limitations of sidechains as a scaling solution for blockchains and suggests Lightning as an alternative. They propose using sidechains for developing new features that can eventually be integrated into the main Bitcoin network. They recommend a federated sidechain for prototyping and provide a link to an idea called "mainstake" for further exploration.Email 2:Nick Farrow explains a draft scheme for blinding and FROST compatibility. The scheme involves obtaining a public nonce, creating an aggregate FROST nonce, and calculating a challenge. The challenge is blinded to enhance security. Participants sign the blinded challenge to create partial signatures, which are combined to form a complete Schnorr signature.Email 3:Dmitry Petukhov announces the release of B'SST, a tool for analyzing Bitcoin and Elements scripts. The tool uses symbolic execution and constraint tracking to generate a report on script analysis. It can utilize the Z3 theorem prover for advanced analysis, but it is not enabled by default.Summary:- ZmnSCPxj discusses the limitations of sidechains and suggests Lightning as an alternative for scaling blockchains.- Nick Farrow explains a draft scheme for blinding and FROST compatibility in Schnorr signatures.- Dmitry Petukhov announces the release of B'SST, a tool for analyzing Bitcoin and Elements scripts using symbolic execution and constraint tracking.

recent_posts.title: Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses initial interest in sidechains, but later realizes they cannot scale.
- They suggest Lightning as a non-blockchain mechanism for scaling blockchains.
- A federated sidechain could serve as a proof-of-concept for developing and prototyping features.

recent_posts.title: Private Collaborative Custody with FROST
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a draft scheme that explains blinding and FROST compatibility.
- Steps include obtaining a public nonce, constructing an aggregate FROST nonce, and calculating a challenge.
- The scheme emphasizes security assessment and suggests signing transactions sequentially to mitigate risks.

recent_posts.title: Announcing B'SST: Bitcoin-like Script Symbolic Tracer
recent_posts.summary:
- Dmitry Petukhov has released B'SST, a tool to analyze Bitcoin and Elements scripts.
- B'SST uses symbolic execution and tracks constraints, and can generate analysis reports.
- The tool supports custom opcodes and is released under the Prosperity Public License 3.0.0.

recent_posts.title: Nucleus: Capital-efficient multipeer Lightning payment channels
recent_posts.summary:
- Existing Bitcoin miners can reorder transactions but not spend funds directly.
- Drivechains allow miners to vote and spend escrowed funds, raising concerns of censorship.
- Proof-of-work mining incentivizes honesty, while proof-of-stake schemes can be captured by censoring stakers.

recent_posts.title: TOR enabled dynamic Proof of Work defense for onion services
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine discusses defending against a botnet and suggests investigating anonymous credentials.
- Staking Credentials replaces cryptosystems with elliptic curve-based ones for the Lightning Network.
- Antoine anticipates a game-theory formalization of the system dynamics and provides resource links.

recent_posts.title: Disclosure: Fake channel DoS vector
recent_posts.summary:
- Matt is commended for finding an issue, testing, and collaborating with different teams.
- The email stresses the need for more contributors to identify issues and improve the project.
- Protecting p2p networks from DoS vectors is difficult, emphasizing the importance of additional involvement.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing a version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- The server will be fully 'blinded' and will not learn certain information.
- The protocol involves key and nonce aggregation to generate the final signature.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark is a new protocol that allows users to send and receive funds without liquidity constraints.
- It uses virtual UTXOs (vTXOs) instead of channels, consuming less on-chain space.
- An intermediary called the Ark Service Provider enables anonymous, off-chain payments through coinjoin sessions.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Blockchain storage is sufficient even with a worst-case scenario of 210.24GB growth per year.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can provide 21 years of storage.
- Efforts to optimize data storage by nodes reduce the space required for blockchain.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests making lightning channels resumable by using wallet seed.
- It introduces a new type of channel funding transaction with fraud proof acceptance.
- The proposal also discusses saving bandwidth and concludes with device usage and alternative options.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- He suggests a multi-stakeholder approach for fairness and transparency in organizing the summit.
- Interested Lightning Network developers can participate and transfer knowledge at lnsummit2024@ariard.me.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan discussed at the summit for HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting CSV file data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.
